refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The Quartz surface is used to render cairo graphics targeting the Apple OS X Quartz rendering system.

refsect2.title: CAIRO_HAS_QUARTZ_SURFACE
refsect2.para: Defined if the Quartz surface backend is available. This macro can be used to conditionally compile backend-specific code.

refsect2.title: cairo_quartz_surface_create ()
refsect2.para: Creates a Quartz surface backed by a CGBitmap. The surface is created using the Device RGB (or Device Gray, for A8) color space. All Cairo operations, including those that require software rendering, will succeed on this surface.

listitem.simpara: format of pixels in the surface to create
width of the surface, in pixels
height of the surface, in pixels

refsect2.title: cairo_quartz_surface_create_for_cg_context ()
refsect2.programlisting: cairo_surface_t * cairo_quartz_surface_create_for_cg_context (CGContextRef cgContext, unsigned int width, unsigned int height);
refsect2.para: Creates a Quartz surface that wraps the given CGContext. The CGContext is assumed to be in the standard Cairo coordinate space (that is, with the origin at the upper left and the Y axis increasing downward). If the CGContext is in the Quartz coordinate space (with the origin at the bottom left), then it should be flipped before this function is called. All Cairo operations are implemented in terms of Quartz operations, as long as Quartz-compatible elements are used (such as Quartz fonts).

listitem.simpara: the existing CGContext for which to create the surface
width of the surface, in pixels
height of the surface, in pixels

refsect2.title: cairo_quartz_surface_get_cg_context ()
refsect2.para: Returns the CGContextRef that the given Quartz surface is backed by.

listitem.simpara: the CGContextRef for the given surface.
